message:
In this case, the deadlock has nothing to do with Task.Run. You could replace the whole Task.Run with a Task.Delay(500) and it would still deadlock.

The deadlock is actually due to the use of .Result from a UI context. I explain in detail here: [http://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/07/dont-block-on-async-code.html](http://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/07/dont-block-on-async-code.html)
